One can see that all values of $c$ in the table of the are hypotenuses

of 5 and 45; $9^2\!+\!40^2 \;=\; 41^2$.\
**Theorem.** Any integer contraharmonic mean of two different positive
integers is the hypotenuse of a Pythagorean triple. Conversely, any
hypotenuse of a Pythagorean triple is contraharmonic mean of two
different positive integers.

[*Proof.*]{} $1^\circ.$ Let the integer $c$ be the contraharmonic mean
$$c \;=\; \frac{u^2\!+\!v^2}{u\!+\!v}$$ of the positive integers $u$ and
$v$ with $u > v$. Then
$u\!+\!v \,\mid\, u^2\!+\!v^2 \,=\, (u\!+\!v)^2-2uv$, whence
$$u\!+\!v \,\mid\, 2uv,$$ and we have the positive integers
$$a \;=:\; u\!-\!v \;=\; \frac{u^2\!-\!v^2}{u\!+\!v}, \quad b \;=:\; \frac{2uv}{u\!+\!v}$$
satisfying
$$a^2\!+\!b^2 \;=\; \frac{(u^2\!-\!v^2)^2\!+\!(2uv)^2}{(u\!+\!v)^2} 
= \frac{u^4\!-\!2u^2v^2+v^4\!+\!4u^2v^2}{(u\!+\!v)^2}  
= \frac{u^4\!+\!2u^2v^2\!+\!v^4}{(u\!+\!v)^2} = \frac{(u^2\!+\!v^2)^2}{(u\!+\!v)^2} \;=\; c^2.\\$$

$2^\circ.$ Suppose that $c$ is the hypotenuse of the Pythagorean triple
$(a,\,b,\,c)$, whence $c^2 = a^2\!+\!b^2$. Let us consider the rational
numbers $$\begin{aligned}
u =: \frac{c\!+\!b\!+\!a}{2}, \quad v =: \frac{c\!+\!b\!-\!a}{2}.\end{aligned}$$
If the triple is , then two of the integers $a,\,b,\,c$ are odd and one
of them is even; if not, then similarly or all of $a,\,b,\,c$ are even.
Therefore, $c\!+\!b\!\pm\!a$ are always even and accordingly $u$ and $v$
positive integers. We see also that $u\!+\!v = c\!+\!b$. Now we obtain
$$\begin{aligned}
u^2\!+\!v^2\; & =\;  \frac{c^2\!+\!b^2\!+\!a^2\!+\!2ab\!+\!2bc\!+\!2ca\!+\!c^2\!+\!b^2\!+\!a^2\!-\!2ab\!+\!2bc\!-\!2ca}{4}\\
              & =\; \frac{2c^2\!+\!2(a^2\!+\!b^2)\!+\!4bc}{4} = \frac{4c^2\!+\!4bc}{4} = c(c\!+\!b)\\
              & =\; c(u\!+\!v).\end{aligned}$$ Thus, $c$ is the
contraharmonic mean $\displaystyle\frac{u^2\!+\!v^2}{u\!+\!v}$ of the
different integers $u$ and $v$. (N.B.: When the values of $a$ and $b$ in
(1) are changed, another value of $v$ is obtained. Cf. the Proposition 4
in the .)

der Mathematik* **65**:2 (2010).
